headline.main: The Hon. Horace Mann on the Relation Between Colleges and the People.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last night, before a large and intelligent audience, the Hon. HORACE MANN lectured in Clinton Hall, Astor-Place, on the subject indicated above. The relation that Colleges bore to the people was little less, he said, than that which the brain bore to the rest of the body. BACON had uttered the maxim that "Knowledge is power," but the practical mind of the present age had formulized the same

docs.snippet: We have received our Utah correspondence to the 11th September. There is no news of importance. A search for the Territorial Library has been made, but unsuccessfully. Snow had begun to fall in the Territory, and several cattle in the mountains had...
docs.lead_paragraph: We have received our Utah correspondence to the 11th September. There is no news of importance. A search for the Territorial Library has been made, but unsuccessfully. Snow had begun to fall in the Territory, and several cattle in the mountains had perished from cold. The army had moved into Winter quarters. Gen. JOHNSTON had assigned the command to Lieut.-Colonel SMITH, and himself entered upon the duties of Commandant of the Department of Utah.

docs.snippet: YELLOW FEVER REPORT.--At the meeting of the Commissioners of Health yesterday, the Health Officer submitted a statistical report showing that a much greater number of infected vessels and imported cases of yellow fever have arrived at Quarantine...
docs.lead_paragraph: YELLOW FEVER REPORT.--At the meeting of the Commissioners of Health yesterday, the Health Officer submitted a statistical report showing that a much greater number of infected vessels and imported cases of yellow fever have arrived at Quarantine during the past two months than at any previous and similar period since the establishment of the institution.

docs.snippet: The examination in this case was concluded yesterday, and Counsel for the State and for the defence summed up the case. The Court assemble at 12 o'clock, when Wm. Cisco, DAVID McLYMAN and Dr. WALLER were the last witnesses called.

headline.main: STATEN ISLAND ARSON REAMINATION.; Close of the Testimony--Summing Up of Counsel.

docs.lead_paragraph: The examination in this case was concluded yesterday, and Counsel for the State and for the defence summed up the case. The Court assemble at 12 o'clock, when Wm. Cisco, DAVID McLYMAN and Dr. WALLER were the last witnesses called.

docs.snippet: M. VON HUMBOLDT has celebrated his ninetieth birthday. An English correspondent. writing from Berlin, says that "never did a conqueror receive congratulations from so many persons and such great distances, as the post-boy had to carry on Tuesday...
docs.lead_paragraph: M. VON HUMBOLDT has celebrated his ninetieth birthday. An English correspondent. writing from Berlin, says that "never did a conqueror receive congratulations from so many persons and such great distances, as the post-boy had to carry on Tuesday morning to the well-known house in the Oransien-burger-scrasse.

docs.snippet: The R. M. steamship Canada, from Liverpool on the 25th Sept., with three days later news from Europe, arrived at Halitax yesterday forenoon, and a telegraphic summary of her news will be found elsewhere. The commercial and monetary news by this...
docs.lead_paragraph: The R. M. steamship Canada, from Liverpool on the 25th Sept., with three days later news from Europe, arrived at Halitax yesterday forenoon, and a telegraphic summary of her news will be found elsewhere. The commercial and monetary news by this arrival is of interest.
